li.a: Department of Academics and Student Learning

div.class: component_container clearfix col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12
component_container clearfix col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12
div.h3: Dublin City Schools Closed Through the end of the School Year

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: As you may be aware, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine has announced all K-12 school buildings will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This announcement also means that there will likely not be a spring sports season in Ohio per information released by the Ohio High School Athletic Association. We continue to be compassionate toward our seniors who have lost sports and so much more due to this pandemic.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dublin City Schools will continue to work diligently to ensure online learning continues. While we are disappointed that our students and teachers will not be returning to school this year, we were prepared for this possibility. Our staff has done a tremendous job of rapidly transitioning to delivering instruction online.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Over the next few weeks, we will be communicating our long-term plans to make sure that our academic expectations are aligned with the Ohio Department of Education’s guidance. You can visit our

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: online learning page at this link

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The District will continue to distribute breakfasts and lunches to students who need them Monday through Friday.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: The meal distribution schedule is posted at this link

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . Chromebook repair is available at Emerald Campus from 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. A new student tech help email address

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: is now in operation. Students can submit any technology issues to this email address.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: These continue to be unprecedented and challenging times. Please continue to take care of one another, practice proper social distancing, and be mindful of your mental health, and that of your family members. We will get through this together.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

div.class: component_container clearfix col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12
component_container clearfix col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12
div.h3: Dublin City Schools Closed March 16-May 1 (Online learning begins March 18)

span.p: In keeping with Gov. Mike DeWine’s order earlier today, Dublin City Schools will be closed for students beginning Monday, March 16 through Friday, May 1. All athletic and extracurricular activities are canceled through Friday, May 1 as well.
As you have probably heard, Gov. DeWine ordered the closure of all Ohio K-12 schools for three weeks in an effort to stop the spread of the Coronavirus.

During that time, our buildings will be completely shut down to students and only essential personnel will remain on site. There will be no activities in our schools and no off-site school activities of any kind.
Online learning will continue during this period of time and detailed information regarding this will be distributed as soon as possible.

This is a rapidly changing situation, so please check our website at www.dublinschools.net frequently for updates. We will communicate on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and via email during the course of this closure, as well.

We ask for your patience as we roll out the online learning model, but if you have specific questions moving forward, please email us at [email protected] so we can work together to get you the information you need.
These are unprecedented and challenging times, but we will get through this as a community.
Links to resources are posted below.

div.class: component_container clearfix col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12

div.div: Below are links to resources regarding COVID-19.

div.a: The latest information from the CDC about COVID-19 can be found at this link
How to talk to children about COVID-19
Ohio Governor Mike DeWine’s statement on COVID-19
Ohio Department of Health COVID-19 information
Dublin City Schools nurse Kim Atherton on how to prevent viruses from spreading

div.div: The District will continue to monitor the latest information. In the event the virus becomes local, a team is already in place that will execute the recommendations of local, state, and federal health officials.
Thank you for your support of Dublin City Schools.

div.p: Web Accessibility & Functionality Specifications: If a person with a disability experiences inaccessible online content related to a Dublin City Schools' program, benefit or service, the person should contact the District's Public Information Officer [email protected] in order to obtain the content in an accessible format. The individual may also file a formal complaint utilizing the procedures set out in Board Policies 2260 and 2260.01 relating to Section 504 and Title II.
